matched.expectedTitle: Local File Inclusion via Resource Endpoint
matched.actualTitle: Path Traversal Vulnerability in /resource Endpoint via Unsanitized filename Parameter
matched.matchReason: Both findings describe the same vulnerability: unsanitized filename parameter in the /resource endpoint allowing potential path traversal attacks. The expected finding references lines 17-20 in routes.py where send_from_directory is called with user-controlled input. The actual finding provides the same location and describes the identical vulnerability pattern - direct use of user-provided filename parameter without validation or sanitization. Both identify unauthorized file access as the primary impact.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, HSTS, CSP)
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate security finding not included in the expected vulnerabilities. The application fails to implement critical HTTP security headers, creating vulnerabilities to clickjacking, MIME type sniffing, SSL/TLS downgrade attacks, and XSS attacks.

extra.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) - No Token Validation
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate security finding not included in the expected vulnerabilities. The application lacks CSRF token protection on forms and POST endpoints, allowing attackers to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of authenticated users.

extra.title: Missing Authentication Implementation - Login Endpoint Does Not Validate Credentials
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate and critical security finding not included in the expected vulnerabilities. The login endpoint contains no credential validation logic and redirects all requests identically, meaning the application has no functioning authentication mechanism.

extra.title: Unrestricted Access to Static Files Without Authentication
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate security finding not included in the expected vulnerabilities. Static resources are accessible without authentication requirements, creating a potential information disclosure vulnerability if sensitive data is placed in static files.

extra.title: No Session Cookies Set - Missing Cookie Security Implementation
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate security finding not included in the expected vulnerabilities. The application does not implement any session cookie management, preventing secure session maintenance and authentication persistence across requests.

extra.title: Missing Brute Force Protection on Login Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate security finding not included in the expected vulnerabilities. The login endpoint implements no rate limiting, account lockout, or throttling mechanisms, allowing unlimited brute force attacks without restrictions.
